data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can’ t use the directions to go backwards. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is the starting point you have just turned around and returned to. So, the answer is yes.

When you take 6 steps, you are already back at the starting point. When you take 4 steps, you are just one step away from turning around. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions are to always face directly forward. A person facing right typically takes 6 steps right. A person facing left takes 6 steps left. On a regular day you would take 7 steps backward and take 10 steps right. In this way, you always face forward. In the second scenario, taking one step left and making the next step towards the starting point would return you to the beginning point. So, the answer is No.
